title: Trump Says He’s Cutting Off Trade Negotiations With Canada
summary: The president said he was motivated by an ad, paid for by the province of Ontario, that featured Ronald Reagan criticizing tariffs in a 1987 radio address.

title: Democrats Block Federal Worker Pay Bill as Shutdown Drags On
summary: A Republican measure that would pay essential government employees faltered in the Senate, and the G.O.P. blocked a pair of Democratic bills to pay a broader swath of workers.

title: Trump’s Sanctions on Russian Oil Sector Ratchet Up Economic War
summary: After months of restraint, President Trump’s move to blacklist Lukoil and Rosneft will hit Russia where it hurts.

title: The U.S. and Europe Are Trying New Ways to Pressure Russia
summary: For the first time in his second term, President Trump is imposing new sanctions, but they may not shift the course of Russia’s war in Ukraine.

title: Trump’s Ballroom Project Claims 123-Year-Old East Wing
summary: Critics are outraged over President Trump’s demolition of the East Wing to make way for his $300 million ballroom. Others say it was time for change.

title: U.S. Charges N.B.A. Figures in Gambling Schemes That Tainted Games
summary: Terry Rozier, a Miami Heat guard, and Chauncey Billups, coach of the Portland Trail Blazers, were among those arrested. Two indictments spanned the worlds of professional sports, Mafia families and online betting.

title: Gambinos and Other NYC Mob Families Are Still in Business
summary: Four of the city’s five Mafia families were part of a high-tech scheme that netted $7 million, prosecutors said, by fleecing high rollers at illegal poker games.

title: NBA Gambling Scandal: What We Know
summary: Two indictments detailed schemes involving sports betting and rigged poker games, prosecutors said. The link was current and former N.B.A. players and coaches.

title: Stavros Halkias Wants a Career. Will His Fans Let Him Have One?
summary: The comedian is pivoting from online notoriety to mainstream roles. It’s harder than it looks.

title: Trump Says He Will Not Seek Authorization for Cartel Strikes
summary: The president said he would bypass Congress rather than ask for approval for his military campaign against drug traffickers, even as he said it would expand from sea to land.

title: Trump Calls Off Federal Operation in San Francisco
summary: President Trump said he had halted a planned federal deployment of immigration agents to the city. It was not clear what that meant for the rest of the Bay Area.

title: Tensions Mount as Agents, Including Gregory Bovino, Clash With Chicagoans
summary: Mr. Bovino, a Border Patrol leader, appeared to use tear gas during a confrontation with residents on Thursday. Plaintiffs in a suit over federal tactics say that violated a court order.

title: Protester Who Played ‘Star Wars’ Song Sues After Arrest in Washington
summary: Sam O’Hara was playing the “Imperial March” theme from the movie while protesting the deployment of National Guard troops in the capital when he was handcuffed by city police officers.

title: With Power Move on Rare Earths, China Plays Both Victim and Bully
summary: In weaponizing its dominance over the crucial minerals, Beijing is using tactics that it once denounced, potentially alienating nations it wants to court.

title: U.S. to Investigate China’s Compliance With 2020 Trade Deal
summary: The trade case is coming at a pivotal moment, before a meeting next week between President Trump and China’s leader.

title: After Remark About Mamdani and Sept. 11, Cuomo Faces Democratic Rebukes
summary: When a radio host suggested that Zohran Mamdani would celebrate another Sept. 11-style attack, Andrew Cuomo chuckled. Democrats denounced the exchange as Islamophobic.

title: How Mamdani Has Evolved in the Mayoral Race
summary: Zohran Mamdani entered the final debate in the New York City mayoral race ahead in the polls. Nicholas Fandos, who covers New York politics and government for The New York Times, describes Mr. Mamdani’s strategy to appeal to the wider electorate before early voting begins.

title: Eric Adams Will Endorse Andrew Cuomo for NYC Mayor
summary: Mayor Eric Adams backed former Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo in the New York City mayor’s race and plans to campaign with him, in hopes of slowing the momentum of Zohran Mamdani, the Democratic nominee.

title: U.S. May Seek United Nations Mandate for Gaza Security Force, Rubio Says
summary: Vice President JD Vance spoke from Israel, as he wrapped up a visit aimed at shoring up a fragile cease-fire between Israel and Hamas.

title: Trump Says Israeli Annexation of West Bank Land ‘Won’t Happen’
summary: Vice President JD Vance also called symbolic votes in Israel’s Parliament to take territory a “very stupid political stunt.”

title: India’s Most Valuable Export: Tens of Millions of Workers
summary: India plans to send its vast work force abroad to countries with labor shortages, like Germany and Japan.

title: You Can Kill a Democracy Without a Dictator
summary: What happens when the state doesn’t curb predatory private powers?

title: How Trump and Xi Can Stop a War Before It Starts
summary: Dangerous close calls are rising, but the U.S. and China still lack the communication channels needed to stop a crisis from becoming a war.

title: Stephen Colbert Tears Into the East Wing Demolition
summary: The East Wing now “looks like a rotisserie chicken your dog got into,” Colbert said on Thursday.

title: Meta Layoffs Included Employees Who Monitored Risks to User Privacy
summary: While the company announced job cuts in artificial intelligence, it also expanded plans to replace privacy and risk auditors with more automated systems.

title: German Company Launches Ad After Its Lift Is Used in Louvre Heist
summary: The brazen daylight robbery of the Louvre on Sunday has turned into a marketing opportunity for Böcker, a German maker of cranes and elevators whose product was used in the heist.

title: A Girls Basketball Team Gives Up Its Title After Spotting a Scoring Error
summary: The team in Oklahoma City forfeited its district championship earlier this year after the coach verified that a scoring error had incorrectly crowned them as winners.

title: Kim Kardashian Announces Brain Aneurysm Diagnosis. Here’s What to Know.
summary: About one in every 50 people has an unruptured brain aneurysm. It was not clear whether Ms. Kardashian had experienced symptoms.
